clusters.title: A fire at a popular nightclub in India's Goa state kills 25
clusters.neutral_headline: Watch: BBC reports from scene of deadly Goa nightclub fire

items.title: A fire at a popular nightclub in India's Goa state kills 25
items.standfirst: At least 25 people, including tourists, were killed in a fire at a popular nightclub in India’s Goa state, the state’s chief minister said Sunday. Goa’s chief minister, Pramod Sawant, said most of the dead were the club’s kitchen workers, as well as three to four tourists. Six people were injured and are in stable condition, he said. All the bodies have been recovered. Story by Morgan Ayre.
items.content: At least 25 people, including tourists, were killed in a fire at a popular nightclub in India’s Goa state, the state’s chief minister said Sunday. Goa’s chief minister, Pramod Sawant, said most of the dead were the club’s kitchen workers, as well as three to four tourists. Six people were injured and are in stable condition, he said. All the bodies have been recovered. Story by Morgan Ayre.

clusters.title: Russia unleashes massive drone attack on central Ukraine, as peace talks stall
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia unleashes massive drone attack on central Ukraine, as peace talks stall

items.title: Russia unleashes massive drone attack on central Ukraine, as peace talks stall
items.standfirst: Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, while Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he had a “substantive phone call” with American officials engaged in talks with a Ukrainian delegation in Florida, aimed at ending the nearly 4-year war. Story by Liza Kaminov.
items.content: Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, while Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he had a “substantive phone call” with American officials engaged in talks with a Ukrainian delegation in Florida, aimed at ending the nearly 4-year war. Story by Liza Kaminov.

items.title: Live: Russia pounds Ukraine's Kremenchuk as US-hosted peace talks wrap up
items.standfirst: Russia launched a major overnight attack on the industrial Ukrainian city of Kremenchuk, striking key water and heating infrastructure, Ukrainian officials said on Sunday. The assault came as a Ukrainian delegation had wrapped up three days of talks with US President Donald Trump’s advisers in Florida, aimed at securing an agreement to end the war. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.
items.content: Russia launched a major overnight attack on the industrial Ukrainian city of Kremenchuk, striking key water and heating infrastructure, Ukrainian officials said on Sunday. The assault came as a Ukrainian delegation had wrapped up three days of talks with US President Donald Trump’s advisers in Florida, aimed at securing an agreement to end the war. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.

items.title: Russia targets Ukraine with massive drone attack amid diplomatic talks
items.standfirst: Russia launched a huge attack on Ukraine overnight as the country marked Armed Forces Day on Saturday, Ukraine's air force said.
items.content: Russia launched a huge attack on Ukraine overnight as the country marked Armed Forces Day on Saturday, Ukraine's air force said.

items.title: Russia hammers Ukraine's energy infrastructure as Florida peace talks continue
items.standfirst: Moscow hammered Ukraine's energy infrastructure with a massive drone and missile barrage overnight into Saturday as US officials continued to hold talks with a Ukrainian delegation in Florida on ending the war. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said he had a "substantive phone call" with the US negotiators.
items.content: Moscow hammered Ukraine's energy infrastructure with a massive drone and missile barrage overnight into Saturday as US officials continued to hold talks with a Ukrainian delegation in Florida on ending the war. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said he had a "substantive phone call" with the US negotiators.

items.title: Russia unleashes drone and missile attack on Ukraine as diplomatic talks continue
items.standfirst: Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, after U.S. and Ukrainian officials said they'll meet on Saturday for talks aimed at ending the war.
items.content: Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, after U.S. and Ukrainian officials said they'll meet on Saturday for talks aimed at ending the war.(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)

clusters.title: Coup d'état underway in Benin: Soldiers claim to have seized power
clusters.neutral_headline: Benin coup attempt live: Soldiers on state TV claim to have toppled Talon

items.title: Coup d'état underway in Benin: Soldiers claim to have seized power
items.standfirst: A group of soldiers on Benin's national television claimed to have seized power in the West African nation on Sunday, the latest threat to democratic norms in the unstable region.
items.content: A group of soldiers on Benin's national television claimed to have seized power in the West African nation on Sunday, the latest threat to democratic norms in the unstable region.

items.title: Live: Coup attempt in Benin has been 'foiled', interior minister says
items.standfirst: Benin's interior minister, Alassane Seidou, said in a statement on Sunday that the West African country's armed forces had thwarted an attempted coup. His statement came after a group of soldiers appeared on Benin's state television claiming to have removed President Patrice Talon from office and dissolved all state institutions. Follow our live blog for all the latest developments.
items.content: Benin's interior minister, Alassane Seidou, said in a statement on Sunday that the West African country's armed forces had thwarted an attempted coup. His statement came after a group of soldiers appeared on Benin's state television claiming to have removed President Patrice Talon from office and dissolved all state institutions. Follow our live blog for all the latest developments.

items.title: Soldiers announce apparent military coup in Benin
items.standfirst: The group, which called itself the Military Committee for Refoundation, on Sunday announced the removal of the president and all state institutions.
items.content: The group, which called itself the Military Committee for Refoundation, on Sunday announced the removal of the president and all state institutions.(Image credit: Eraldo Peres)

items.standfirst: Soldiers appeared on Benin's national television on Sunday, announcing that the government will be dissolved.In what appears to be a military coup, the soldiers led by Lieutenant Colonel Pascal Tigri ...
items.content: Soldiers appeared on Benin's national television on Sunday, announcing that the government will be dissolved.In what appears to be a military coup, the soldiers led by Lieutenant Colonel Pascal Tigri ...

items.title: Benin Soldiers Claim They Have Taken Control In Coup Attempt
Benin coup attempt live: Soldiers on state TV claim to have toppled Talon
items.standfirst: Group of soldiers announce the removal of President Patrice Talon and all state institutions.
items.content: Group of soldiers announce the removal of President Patrice Talon and all state institutions.

items.title: Soldiers announce apparent military coup in Benin, President Talon is 'safe', says army
items.standfirst: A group of soldiers on Benin's national television claimed to have seized power in the West African nation on Sunday, the latest threat to democratic norms in the unstable region. However, the situation remained unclear with soldiers loyal to Benin’s President Patrice Talon claiming to have foiled the coup attempt to overthrow the government, his office said, adding that the country’s leader is safe.
items.content: A group of soldiers on Benin's national television claimed to have seized power in the West African nation on Sunday, the latest threat to democratic norms in the unstable region. However, the situation remained unclear with soldiers loyal to Benin’s President Patrice Talon claiming to have foiled the coup attempt to overthrow the government, his office said, adding that the country’s leader is safe.

clusters.title: Dozens dead after drone strikes on Sudan kindergarten, hospital, local official says
clusters.neutral_headline: Deadly attack on kindergarten reported in Sudan

items.title: Dozens dead after drone strikes on Sudan kindergarten, hospital, local official says
items.standfirst: Nearly 80 people – more than half of them children – have been killed in a series of drone strikes targeting a kindergarten, a hospital and rescue teams in southern Sudan, local officials said on Sunday, blaming the attacks on the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, RSF.
items.content: Nearly 80 people – more than half of them children – have been killed in a series of drone strikes targeting a kindergarten, a hospital and rescue teams in southern Sudan, local officials said on Sunday, blaming the attacks on the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, RSF.

items.content: At least 50 people, including 33 children, have been killed in southern Sudan after a drone attack by paramilitary forces hit a nursery in South Kordofan state.

items.title: Hegseth gives defiant speech defending ‘drug boat’ strikes amid scrutiny
items.standfirst: At event in California, US defense secretary says Trump has power to take military action ‘as he sees fit’Pete Hegseth on Saturday doubled down on his defense of US military strikes on alleged drug cartel boats in the Caribbean, arguing that Donald Trump has the power to take military action “as he sees fit” and dismissing concerns that the strikes violate international law.Hegseth spoke on Saturday at the Ronald Reagan presidential library in Simi Valley, California, amid growing scrutiny over the legality of the attacks and his leadership of the Pentagon. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: National Park Service drops free admission on Martin Luther King Jr. Day and Juneteenth while adding Trump’s birthday

items.title: National parks fee-free calendar drops MLK Day, Juneteenth and adds Trump's birthday
items.standfirst: The Trump administration, which has railed against what it describes as "woke" policies, removed MLK Day and Juneteenth from next year's list of fare-exempt days for visitors at dozens of national parks.

items.standfirst: Police launch ‘manhunt’ after 25 people are shot in early morning in township attack west of PretoriaGunmen have stormed into a hostel in South Africa’s capital and killed at least 12 people, including a three-year-old child, and injured more than a dozen others.Police said they had launched a “manhunt” for three people and were investigating whether the killings were linked to a bar within the hostel that may have been selling alcohol illegally. clusters.title: Polls open for legislative elections in Hong Kong after deadly fire
clusters.neutral_headline: Polls open for legislative elections in Hong Kong after deadly fire

items.title: Polls open for legislative elections in Hong Kong after deadly fire
items.standfirst: This Sunday, Hong Kong voters are heading to the polls for their second legislative election since the 2021 electoral overhaul, which effectively removed the pro-democracy opposition. This vote comes less than two weeks after a devastating fire that claimed the lives of at least 159 people. The election results may provide insights into public sentiment regarding the government's management of this tragic event, serving as a crucial test of their handling of the crisis. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Beijing, Jan Camenzind Broomby.
items.content: This Sunday, Hong Kong voters are heading to the polls for their second legislative election since the 2021 electoral overhaul, which effectively removed the pro-democracy opposition. This vote comes less than two weeks after a devastating fire that claimed the lives of at least 159 people. The election results may provide insights into public sentiment regarding the government's management of this tragic event, serving as a crucial test of their handling of the crisis. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Beijing, Jan Camenzind Broomby.

clusters.title: Gaza mediators Qatar and Egypt call for next steps of the truce
clusters.neutral_headline: Qatar and Egypt urge Israeli withdrawal to secure next step in Gaza peace deal

items.title: Gaza mediators Qatar and Egypt call for next steps of the truce
items.standfirst: Qatar and Egypt, guarantors of the Gaza ceasefire, called on Saturday for the withdrawal of Israeli troops and the deployment of an international stabilisation force as the necessary next steps in fully implementing the fragile agreement. The measures were spelt out in the US- and UN-backed peace plan that has largely halted fighting, though the warring parties have yet to agree on how to move forward from the deal's first phase. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Jerusalem, Noga Tarnopolsky.
items.content: Qatar and Egypt, guarantors of the Gaza ceasefire, called on Saturday for the withdrawal of Israeli troops and the deployment of an international stabilisation force as the necessary next steps in fully implementing the fragile agreement. The measures were spelt out in the US- and UN-backed peace plan that has largely halted fighting, though the warring parties have yet to agree on how to move forward from the deal's first phase. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Jerusalem, Noga Tarnopolsky.

items.title: How the Netflix-Warner Bros. Deal Changes Hollywood
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. has agreed to purchase the streaming and studio assets of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. in a $72 billion deal that’s likely to impact the entertainment industry for decades.
items.content: Netflix Inc. has agreed to purchase the streaming and studio assets of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. in a $72 billion deal that’s likely to impact the entertainment industry for decades.

items.title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in $72 Billion Cash, Stock Deal | Bloomberg Tech 12/5/2025
items.standfirst: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery after it completes the planned spinoff of its cable channels. Plus, the European Union Ambassador to the US responds to criticism of the $140 million fine the bloc has levied on Elon Musk’s social media platform X. And HPE CEO, Antonio Neri, discusses the company’s outlook after reporting disappointing 4Q AI server sales. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery after it completes the planned spinoff of its cable channels. Plus, the European Union Ambassador to the US responds to criticism of the $140 million fine the bloc has levied on Elon Musk’s social media platform X. And HPE CEO, Antonio Neri, discusses the company’s outlook after reporting disappointing 4Q AI server sales. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: HPE’s AI Servers Ready as Soon Data Centers Are, Says CEO
items.standfirst: HPE CEO Antonio Neri discusses the company’s earnings as its sales for AI servers fall short. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech”. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: HPE CEO Antonio Neri discusses the company’s earnings as its sales for AI servers fall short. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech”. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix, Warner Bros. Face Road to Finalizing Deal
items.standfirst: Finalizing the deal between Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery will be a longer and bigger fight than Game of Thrones, says Jon Klein, co-founder of Hang Media. The former head of CNN discusses the challenges facing the tie-up and the competition Netflix faces from YouTube and the creator economy. He speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Finalizing the deal between Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery will be a longer and bigger fight than Game of Thrones, says Jon Klein, co-founder of Hang Media. The former head of CNN discusses the challenges facing the tie-up and the competition Netflix faces from YouTube and the creator economy. He speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix Breaks From ‘Build, Not Buy’ With Warner Bros. Deal
items.standfirst: Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a historic $72 billion cash and stock deal. Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw discusses the combination of the world’s dominant paid streaming service with one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a historic $72 billion cash and stock deal. Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw discusses the combination of the world’s dominant paid streaming service with one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix–Warner Bros. Deal Sets Up $72 Billion Antitrust Test
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. has won the heated takeover battle for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. Now it must convince global antitrust regulators that the deal won’t give it an illegal advantage in the streaming market.
items.content: Netflix Inc. has won the heated takeover battle for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. Now it must convince global antitrust regulators that the deal won’t give it an illegal advantage in the streaming market.

items.title: EU Can Regulate Tech, Bloc's US Ambassador Says
items.standfirst: European Union Ambassador to the US Jovita Neliupšienė talks about why bloc fined Elon Musk's X social network €120 million ($140 million) for violating a content-moderation law. She says the European Commission doesn’t target any one country or company with its rules. She discusses the EU’s approach to tech, defense, and the use of frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine's war effort. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: European Union Ambassador to the US Jovita Neliupšienė talks about why bloc fined Elon Musk's X social network €120 million ($140 million) for violating a content-moderation law. She says the European Commission doesn’t target any one country or company with its rules. She discusses the EU’s approach to tech, defense, and the use of frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine's war effort. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in Historic $72 Billion Deal
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., marking a seismic shift in the entertainment business as a Silicon Valley-bred streaming giant tries to swallow one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios.
items.content: Netflix Inc. agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., marking a seismic shift in the entertainment business as a Silicon Valley-bred streaming giant tries to swallow one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios.

items.title: At least 18 migrants die after boat sinks near Greek island of Crete
items.standfirst: The migrants were attempting to cross the Mediterranean Sea in an inflatable boat when it capsized south of the island of Crete, Greek authorities said Saturday. At least two people have been rescued.
items.content: The migrants were attempting to cross the Mediterranean Sea in an inflatable boat when it capsized south of the island of Crete, Greek authorities said Saturday. At least two people have been rescued.

items.title: At least 18 migrants die as inflatable boat sinks off Greek island of Crete
items.standfirst: At least 18 people attempting to reach Europe by inflatable boat drowned after their dinghy capsized south of the Greek island of Crete, authorities said Saturday. Two people have been rescued so far as the search for survivors continues.
items.content: At least 18 people attempting to reach Europe by inflatable boat drowned after their dinghy capsized south of the Greek island of Crete, authorities said Saturday. Two people have been rescued so far as the search for survivors continues.

clusters.neutral_headline: Playwright Jeremy O Harris arrested in Japan for alleged drug smuggling

items.title: Prominent U.S. playwright arrested in Japan for alleged ecstasy smuggling
items.standfirst: Japanese officials said Jeremy O Harris, known for his Tony-nominated "Slave Play" and his role in the series "Emily in Paris," was arrested on the island of Okinawa on Nov. 16.
items.content: Japanese officials said Jeremy O Harris, known for his Tony-nominated "Slave Play" and his role in the series "Emily in Paris," was arrested on the island of Okinawa on Nov. 16.

items.title: Playwright Jeremy O Harris arrested in Japan for alleged drug smuggling
items.standfirst: The writer of the Tony award-nominated Slave Play remains in custody after authorities say they found MDMA in his bagAmerican actor and playwright Jeremy O Harris, known for the Tony-nominated Slave Play, was arrested last month at an airport in Japan on suspicion of attempting to smuggle illegal drugs into the country, local authorities said late on Thursday.Harris, 36, was stopped on 16 November at Naha airport on Okinawa island after a customs officer discovered 0.78 grams of crystal containing the synthetic drug MDMA in his tote bag, an Okinawa regional customs spokesperson said. Continue reading...
items.content: The writer of the Tony award-nominated Slave Play remains in custody after authorities say they found MDMA in his bagAmerican actor and playwright Jeremy O Harris, known for the Tony-nominated Slave Play, was arrested last month at an airport in Japan on suspicion of attempting to smuggle illegal drugs into the country, local authorities said late on Thursday.Harris, 36, was stopped on 16 November at Naha airport on Okinawa island after a customs officer discovered 0.78 grams of crystal containing the synthetic drug MDMA in his tote bag, an Okinawa regional customs spokesperson said. Continue reading...

clusters.neutral_headline: Google Must Limit Default Contracts to One Year, Judge Rules

items.title: Judge orders Google to rebid for default search deals every year in a major antitrust blow
items.standfirst: A federal judge ordered Google to limit default search and AI app contracts to one year. - The ruling follows a 2024 finding that Google illegally monopolized online search markets. - The decision aims to boost competition from rivals in search apps and generative AI. A judge opened the door to…
items.content: A federal judge ordered Google to limit default search and AI app contracts to one year. - The ruling follows a 2024 finding that Google illegally monopolized online search markets. - The decision aims to boost competition from rivals in search apps and generative AI. items.title: Google Must Limit Default Contracts to One Year, Judge Rules
items.standfirst: Alphabet Inc.’s Google must renegotiate any contract to make its search engine or artificial intelligence app the default for smartphones and other devices every year, a federal judge ruled.
items.content: Alphabet Inc.’s Google must renegotiate any contract to make its search engine or artificial intelligence app the default for smartphones and other devices every year, a federal judge ruled.

items.title: Waymo Plans Software Recall to Address Bus Incidents
